entry.content:
Problem 1

Brief on Question

What is known?

  • With only kinetic energy, no potential energy.

What is asked?

  • Find results of measurements and corresponding probabilities of $L_{z}$.
  • Find results of measurements and corresponding probabilities of $E$.
  • Expectation value $\langle L_{z}\rangle$.
  • Expectation value $\langle E\rangle$.
  • Measured $+2 \hbar$ for $L_{z}$, then find results of measurements and corresponding probabilities of $E$.
  • Measured $E=4 \hbar^{2} /(2 \mathrm{I})$, then find results of measurements and corresponding probabilities of $L_{z}$.

Sample Solution

For $L_{z}$

  • $m$ takes $4$ different values: $-2,0,1,2$
  • $L_{z}=-2 \hbar, 0\hbar, 1\hbar, 2\hbar$
    • $P_{-2}=\left|\frac{1}{\sqrt{10}}\right|^{2}=0.1=10 \%$
    • $P_{0}=\left|\frac{2 i}{\sqrt{10}}\right|^{2}=0.4=40 \%$
    • $P_{1}=\left|\frac{1 i}{\sqrt{10}}\right|^{2}=0.1=10 \%$
    • $P_{2}=\left|\frac{2}{\sqrt{10}}\right|^{2}=0.4=40 \%$
  • $\left\langle L_{z}\right\rangle=0.1(-2 \hbar)+0.4(0)+0.1(\hbar)+0.4(2 \hbar)=0.7 \hbar$

For $E$

  • $m$ takes $4$ different values: $0,1,\pm 2$
  • $L_{z}=0, \frac{\hbar^{2}}{2 I}, \frac{4 \hbar^{2}}{2 I}$
    • $P_{0}=\left|\frac{2 i}{\sqrt{10}}\right|^{2}=0.4=40 \%$
    • $P_{1}=\left|\frac{1 i}{\sqrt{10}}\right|^{2}=0.1=10 \%$
    • $P_{2}=10 \%+40 \%=50 \%$
  • $E=\frac{\hbar^{2}}{2 I}\left(0.5 \cdot 2^{2}+0.4 \cdot 0+0.1 \cdot 1^{1}\right)=\frac{1.05 \hbar^{2}}{I}$

entry.title: A Short Review: About the Rydberg atom based Quantum Computing
entry.content:
Physics Background

General Background on Quantum Computing

In the last century, after the Turing machine model made a major breakthrough in classical computers, scientists have been considering the possibilities of Hyper computation models. One of those models is the quantum computing. The concept of quantum computing was first proposed by the famous physicist Feynman in 1981. [1] This is a design that uses unitary operator and Hilbert space as the description of the system to express effectively computable information. Specifically, each qubit is in superposition of $\left|0\right\rangle$ and $\left|1\right\rangle$ eigenstates, and the entanglement and quantum decoherence effects enable us to get a quantum superposition state in the system $\sum{i=0}^{2^{n}- 1} a{i}\left|x{i}\right\rangle, \left|a{i}\right|^{2}=1, a_{i}\in\mathbb{C}$, the information that the system can represent grows by $2^n$, while the classical computer grows by $2n$. Therefore, quantum computers are be superior to classical computers in terms of computational complexity. However, both are implementations of the Turing machine computing model, and the computing power is essentially equivalent, and both are effectively computable, as described by Church-Turing Thesis. It is worth mentioning that the computing power of a quantum computer has an upper limit. It is called Bremermann‚Äôs limit and the value is $\frac{c^{2}}{\hbar}bits/s$, which is caused by the mechanism of quantum mechanics. Yes, more powerful calculations require more energy so that the computing system will collapse into a black hole.\

In the beginning, Feynman proposed the concept of quantum computing to use simple quantum systems to simulate the evolution of complex and difficult quantum systems, which is efficiency impossible to achieve on classical computers. The idea he put forward at the time seems to be more like a quantum simulation than quantum computation. [2][3] In order to show exactly what a quantum computer is, six outstanding quantum physicists proposed that ‚Äúa quantum computer is a machine that would exploit the full complexity, a many-particle quantum wavefunction to solve a computational problem.‚Äù [4] However, a more rigorous statement was put forward by Dr. DiVincenzo. [6] DiVincenzo‚Äôs criteria specify the following five necessary conditions for quantum computers:

  • have a sequence of qubits with scalability;
  • qubits and can be initialized;
  • have a long decoherence time;
  • have a sequence of quantum logic gates;
  • the qubits can be measured with some methods.

There are two main aspects to the development of quantum computing, and the separately introduction are as follows.

Firstly is the software level. The initial work focused on the quantum Fourier transform algorithm, which is actually an extension of quantum simulation. But soon, people got a breakthrough in Shor‚Äôs algorithm, which can accomplish the 1000-digit factorization in a fraction of a second. [7] This is also the reason why the idea of a general quantum computer being inspired at the first place. Shor‚Äôs pioneering work strongly stimulated the development of quantum computers and quantum cryptography. [8] In 1980, Dr. Benioff proved that any computation corresponds to the evolution of a quantum system. [9] This provides the theoretical basis. Other developments to be remembered also include the Quantum Annealing, which reveal the power of quantum computer algorithm in the field of optimization. [10]

More exciting developments are happening at the hardware level. The main quantum computer implementation methods include optical quantum computer [11][12], topological quantum computer [13], quantum dot system, ion trap system [14][15][16], neutral atom quantum computer and superconductor quantum computer. [17][18] The most outstanding results are superconducting quantum computers and ion trap quantum computers. Superconductivity is stronger than ion traps in terms of scalability in the number of qubits, but ion traps are superior in control accuracy and coherence maintenance. As for the others, theoretically, topological quantum computing has the ability to completely isolate external interference, but it has no reliable experimental results so far, so there is not much discussion. The disadvantage of the quantum dot system is that the fidelity of the dual-qubit gate is hovering around 99.0\%, plus the lack of scalability. Although it performs great in specific quantum algorithms [19], the optical quantum computer lacks in generalization.\

In the next subsection, I will briefly review the past research on the path of neutral atom systems. Before 2016, for the realization of quantum computing, the neutral atom system did not have obvious competitiveness compared with other systems. The mainstream thinking at that time was still the superconducting loop and ion trap. In fact, until today, these two are still the leading ones on the road of quantum computing: a sequence of computation evaluation parameters including double-qubit gate fidelity [20][21], time-costing [22][23] and quantum decoherence time [24] have performed very well. The scalability of the qubit is also considerable. The universality of the optical quantum computing system is being questioned. The topological quantum computing system has never demonstrated the manipulation of single qubit experimentally. The fidelity of the quantum dot system is poor.

Recent developments of Rydberg atom Quantum Computing

As mentioned in the previous section, the quantum computer of the neutral particle system does not have any outstanding performance. At that time, only the ability of single-atom observation was developed, but the ability of single-atom addressing was not yet available. The rest of the work mainly implemented some simple quantum logic gates. In 2016, the Rydberg neutral particle system ushered in a breakthrough, several different laboratories have completed the preparation of defect-free Rydberg atomic arrays: Dr Jaewook Ahn from KAIS used LCOS-SLM [25], Dr. A. Browaeys from CNRS used SLM and acoustic-optical deflector [26][27] and Dr. MD Lukin from Harvard and Caltech‚Äôs Dr. Endres used CCD and acoustic-optical deflector [28]. Dr. A. Browaeys and Dr. M.D. Lukin also implemented a quantum simulator in 2020. [29][30] Using Rydberg neutral particles as a qubit has a series of huge advantages: long coherence time means more stable operation, rich forms of long-range interaction means simpler production of quantum logic gate, The identity of neutral particles means easier entanglement, and experiments show that the Rydberg system has amazing scalability. Despite many many advantages, the Rydberg system still has many problems to be solved. The biggest problem is that the fidelity of the quantum logic gate is still not high enough, and the fidelity drops very seriously when there are a large number of qubits. Moreover, Rydberg laser technology can be improved, and the main work is to reduce line width and various noises. Another point must be mentioned, single qubit addressing in a large-scale atom array is a problem to be solved. From 2020 to 2021, in order to continue to improve the capabilities of the Rydberg quantum computer, physicists have devoted themselves to the study of the many-body interaction of Rydberg atoms. [31][32] I also hope to do this work during my phd career.

entry.title: Classical Empires Assignment: a review of Emperor Hadrian
entry.content:
What I want to talk about today is the rule of the Roman Emperor Hadrian. Hadrian was the emperor who reigned from 117 to 138. He inherited the political legacy of his cousin, Emperor Trajan. He was listed as one of the five emperors of the Roman Empire by Edward Gibbon. Gibbon eulogizes the politics of the five emperors in his The History Of the Decline and Fall of the Roman Empire, which is an important historical material. In ideology, he rebuilt the Pantheon and strengthened the religious stability in Rome. From the military view, he ended the endless war in the East and built Hadrian‚Äôs Wall. Economically, Britain‚Äôs agricultural production has been greatly developed under his rule. He was the first emperor to step across the territory of the empire, I believe this the trailer of the expansion of Roman identity. But he also has shortcomings. He suppressed Christianity and cannot realize that monotheism was far stronger than polytheism in maintaining the centripetal nature of the government. He is also unable to solve the political and economic crisis in Rome, and can only delay the crisis through the existing expansion results and personal prestige.

Hadrian‚Äôs inheritance of Trajan‚Äôs political legacy was not all smooth sailing, but it is clear that Hadrian solved this problem very well, although some historians suspect that Trajan may never officially designate a successor. However, the good attitude of the emperor Trajan and the queen towards Hadrian made Hadrian establish the image of Trajan‚Äôs orthodox heir in Rome. Trajan ordered Hadrian to serve as the commander of the army during several crusades, which enabled Hadrian to establish a high prestige among the eastern armies of the empire. When Trajan tragically died during the last Eastern Expedition, Hadrian was able to quickly get the support of the Queen and the Eastern Legion, forcing the Senate far away in Rome to accept the set result. Even so, there was still a political struggle in which four opposing senators were executed.

Hadrian was a very conscientious emperor. After establishing authority and legitimacy, he quickly led the Eastern Legion back to the division and presided over the political situation. Generally speaking, the core method of Emperor Hadrian‚Äôs governance of the empire and control of his own power can be summed up as defense. I think this is due to the gradual decline of the Roman slavery economy. The economic development of slave estates requires the constant supply of new slaves and uncultivated land without ownership. The empire has long achieved this goal through continuous external conquests. But as the territory of the empire expanded to a certain extent, more and more slave owners yearned for more slaves and land. But on the other hand, the harsh border environment and undeveloped land to be conquered made the empire‚Äôs expansion increasingly weak in Hadrian‚Äôs time. This contradiction caused a political crisis in the empire. The bankruptcy of the freedmen reduced the empire‚Äôs excellent reserve personnel. The political and economic crisis will soon evolve into a military conflict after the five sage emperors.

In response to this new era, Hadrian has taken a series of measures. In terms of foreign policy, Hadrian abandoned the provinces of Assyria and Mesopotamia conquered by Trajan. He eased the relationship with the Parthians and ended the long war on the Eastern battlefield. On the other hand, it brutally suppressed the Jewish Bar Kokhba revolt and changed the Jewish province to Syria and Palestine, weakening national identity and strengthening Roman rule. In the same way in the West, he built Hadrian‚Äôs Wall to prevent the Picts from invading, and alleviating the burden was internal. He promoted Greek culture, which laid the foundation for the later Hellenization of the empire.

As a connecting emperor, Hadrian successfully completed the transformation of the Roman Empire from offensive to defensive. This mysterious and contradictory emperor passed away in 138 AD. He accepted a war-torn Rome and left one behind. The culturally open empire is the epitome of the entire era of the five sage emperors.

entry.title: A Short Review: The topological materials and the topological order
entry.content:
From Hall Effect to topological materials

The entire field can be traced back to the earliest when the Hall effect was discovered. In 1879, Edwin Hall, a Ph.D. student at Johns Hopkins University in Maryland, discovered the Hall effect (QE). [1] This phenomenon indicates that a voltage proportional to the magnetic field will be generated in the direction perpendicular to the current and the applied magnetic field.

With the advancement of technology, the German physicist von Klitzing at Max Planck Institute discovered that when the magnetic field increases to a certain extent, the Hall voltage actually rises in steps. This is called the Integer Quantum Hall Effect (IQHE). [2] The integers appearing in the Hall effect are some topological quantum numbers, called Chern numbers. After observing a non-integer Hall voltage. The Fractional Quantum Hall Effect (FQHE) was discovered by Robert Laughlin, Daniel Tsui and others. [3][4]

In 2005, a new study guided the Quantum Spin Hall Effect (QSHE), which is essentially the quantization of the abnormal Hall effect part. [5] It brings us a new state of matter. We call them two-dimensional topological insulators (TI), and they have special edge effects: there are some special quantum states on the surface.

If one material is topologically nontrivial and another material is topologically trivial, put them together. There will be a topological phase change on the contact surface, and this phase change will have some physical phenomena: for example, the surface conductivity of topological insulators. In order to describe this phase transition, we need to find the topological invariants, such as Chern number [6] and Z2 invariant [7], or hopf fibration [8], topological order [9] and returning Thouless pump [8]. Based on Pontrjagin‚Äôs research on the dual-band Hamiltonian in the three-momentum dimension, Dr. Alexandradinata‚Äôs team studied a new topological invariant: returning Thouless pump (RTP), and did a detailed study of the Hopf-RTP relation. Generally speaking, different topological quantum states can be described by different topological invariants. Therefore, determining the topological invariant of the electronic structure of a material system is the core of judging its topological properties. [10][11] This topological invariant is closely related to Berry‚Äôs phase [12][13], so Chern‚ÄìGauss‚ÄìBonnet theorem can be a very helpful tool. [14] Dr. Alexandradinata and Dr. Syzranov of UCSC both have important contribution in this field. [15] [8] [16] Some other information that I would like to check during phd are [17][18][19]. Dr. Alexandradinata most recent reseearch[8]

Quantum Spin Liquid and topological order

‚ÄúQuantum Spin Liquid‚Äù (QSL) was proposed by Anderson in a 1973 paper. In the original ‚ÄúResonating Valence Bond‚Äù theory (RVB), there are some errors, so it has not received the attention it deserves. [20] After a long time, due to the discovery of high-temperature superconductivity, people renewed emphasis on quantum spin liquid, and Resonating Valence Bond and Valence Bond State (VBS) were gradually improved. [21] Spin liquid refers to spin frustration caused by a certain geometric symmetry or the complexity of interaction, a state in which a ground state presents a disordered state, including spin glass and quantum spin liquid. The biggest difference between quantum spin liquid and the former is the existence of long-range RVB. This quantum fluctuation means the existence of long-range entanglement, which is of great help to our understanding of entanglement. [24] QSL state has nothing to do with spontaneous symmetry breaking [22], so it does not involve Landau phase transition theory [23]. Our understanding of it may require a deeper understanding of topological order. This makes QSL research has great potential. The existence of long-range entanglement and strong coherence makes this field possible to lead topological quantum computing and quantum communication to make more progress in the future. This review is of great help to me in understanding the recent developments in the field of QSL research. [24] Dr. Syzranov‚Äôs paper is also helpful here. [25]

In the previous section we mentioned the idea of topological order. In 1989, Wen Xiaogang put the fractional quantum Hall state on different topological manifolds to probe the new paradigm implicit in the fractional quantum Hall state. This brings us to the concept of topological order. [26][9] Different from Landau‚Äôs symmetry breaking theory, topological order is a new state of matter. I don‚Äôt know enough about it. I will carefully drill the basic theory in the phd stage to prepare for research. Citing the original paper here. [27]
